subject: Re : reply soon
msgSnippet: Hi, Please post any Cactus related questions to jakarta- commons@jakarta.apache.org (to subscribe send an email to jakarta-
messageBody:
Hi,
Please post any Cactus related questions to jakarta-
commons@... (to subscribe send an email to jakarta-
commons-subscribe@...). If you need directions go and
check the Cactius web site at http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/cactus

Thanks
P.S.: I'll answer your question on that newsgroup ... :)

Vincent

--- Dans junit@e..., "Sandhya Sree" <sandhya.sree@m...> a Ã©crit
> Hi,
> Though I have set the class path for Cactus.properties file..As my
> servlet engine does not support web applications, i
> have set the CLASSPATH in my servlet engine.... it is throwing the
> following exception
>
> java.io.FileNotFoundException:
> http://172.20.10.100/PayMate/ServletRedirector
> at
> sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream
(HttpURLConnection.java:526)
>
> at
> org.apache.commons.cactus.client.ServletHttpClient.doTest
(ServletHttpClient.java:109)
>
> at
> org.apache.commons.cactus.ServletTestCase.runGenericTest
(ServletTestCase.java:153)
>
> at
> org.apache.commons.cactus.ServletTestCase.runTest
(ServletTestCase.java:128)
>
> at
> org.apache.commons.cactus.AbstractTestCase.runBare
(AbstractTestCase.java:266)
>
> [Note:I have followed the steps given in
> commons-cactus-23-20010502\doc\installation.html]
>
> i have set in the properties file
> like.."http://172.20.10.100/PayMate/ServletRedirector"
> regards
> sandhya sree
